meanings.definition: Attempt to explain or justify (one's own or another's behavior or attitude) with logical reasons, even if these are not appropriate.
meanings.sent1: She tried to rationalize her decision to stay up late by saying she needed to finish her homework.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to rationalize his actions, even when they don't make sense to others.
meanings.sent3: It's hard to rationalize eating ice cream for breakfast, but she did it anyway.
meanings.sent4: He tried to rationalize his fear of spiders by claiming they were tiny aliens invading his home.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to rationalize his controversial statement only made matters worse.

meanings.definition: Make (a company, process, or industry) more efficient or better organized by introducing new methods.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to rationalize the production line to reduce waste and increase productivity.
meanings.sent2: The company needed to rationalize its operations to compete in the market.
meanings.sent3: The idea to rationalize the filing system by color-coding the folders was surprisingly effective.
meanings.sent4: She managed to rationalize the chaotic schedule into a well-organized calendar.
meanings.sent5: The new software helped rationalize the inventory management process, saving time and resources.
